title: SMART launches research group to advance AI, automation, and the future of work
summary: SMART, the Singapore MIT-Alliance for Research and Technology, has launched a new interdisciplinary research group called M3S. The group aims to address social and institutional challenges related to artificial intelligence (AI) and other new technologies. M3S will focus on the human-machine relationship and work towards designing inclusive and innovative solutions that empower individuals, institutions, and cities. The project is supported by a multimillion-dollar grant from the National Research Foundation of Singapore and will involve collaboration between MIT and institutions in Singapore. The research will cover areas such as physical and digital interfaces, machine learning, and the impact of AI on human welfare and productivity.
